Reviews.Title: “Next to the Wall”
Reviews.Author: TrudieA
Reviews.Content: This Ibis hotel is well located, walking distance from the West train station in Berlin, and around 2-3 kilometers away from the city center. The staff is very nice and very helpful. When we asked about places to have dinner, for example, they gave us different options and the directions on how to get there. The area is OK, it is right next to a big part of The Wall that now has paintings/art on it, and it is peaceful enough for sleeping. The rooms are Ibis quality standard; can't complaint. The bathroom is usually smaller than what we are used to in the US but still OK for the purposes of having a clean toilet and shower.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and cheap”
Reviews.Author: Lebinbrussels Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Typical ibis hotel. was not really very central, but that was not a problem with the subway station being a 5 mins walk from the hotel. We came to this hotel after a huge disappointed in furnished apartment we have booked, and turned out to be everything except what was shown in the photos, so as a last minute booking, the Ibis was cheap (around 70 euros per night). This was the internet rate, be careful not go book at the reception, you won't get the offer, i complained, and the lady asked me to try booking it at the reception computer and pay with my credit card ! the people at the reception were not that friendly, and made you feel that they just wanted you to leave them alone. don't take the breakfast there, expensive, and basic. there is a nice snack/patisserie on the same street, 3 mins from the hotel run by a friendly family of arabs or turks, and they have much cheaper delicacies. The room was basic, nice, modern and clean !

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the eConcierge "service"”
Reviews.Author: Matthew S
Reviews.Content: IBIS hotels gave my contact details to an online ("eConcierge") partner company. My time in Berlin was short so I bought a Berlin Welcome Card (the city-wide transport ticket for visitors), expecting it to be waiting for me at the hotel. After all, that's what a hotel concierge is for. It wasn't. I had to buy a travel ticket in order to travel 6km to collect the ticket. The ticket office could have sold me the same ticket across the counter for a lower price. So what was the point of this concierge service? I complained to the hotel that they were being misleading and dishonest by offering this service. But their answer was, and I quote, "please be assured that this service has nothing to do with our hotel." Uh? You sent the email inviting me: "To help you plan your trip, why not take advantage of the services and recommendations provided by your e-concierge!" I wrote again and was met with total rejection of my concerns. So there you have it. IBIS uses its name to sell services and get commission, and then walks away when a customer points out that it's a total waste of time and money.

Reviews.Title: “Great basic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I'm staying here since many years when in Berlin. Easy check-in. Very friendly, helpfull staff. Rooms are very basic, but functional and have a good size - not just cupboards. Great location - 2 minutes to Bus & U-Bahn.

Reviews.Title: “October 2011”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay with very friendly and helpful staff. Pleasant rooms with all home comforts. Easy access to U-Bahn and Strasse Bahn and all toursit attractions. Will visit again and will recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Close to subway station. Small but clean room, a bit utilitarian, but great value for the prize. It was wonderful to have an airconditioned room in the hot, humid weather. Free Wifi in the lobby only, otherwise a bit too expensive for internet in the room. Skipped breakfast, as this was very expensive as well.

Reviews.Title: “Alkis's stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good location and excellent service for the price they provided The location is close to a metro station. The room was clean and the room was big enough the front desk was very helpful and answered all questions

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Some of the members of the hotel staf were very helpful, some were not. We have found a children's toy under our bed so it means thet the cleaing was not very precise. Breakfast room is too small for the capacity of the hotel so it was difficult to find a place on different hours. But the hotel is in a quiet area, not far from U-Bahn, the price is very resonable so...

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet and”
Reviews.Author: Karel99
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in April in this hotel. Hotel is located in the west of Berlin in very quiet area. Hotel is probably new build (or just after the reconstruction), looks pretty good. The U-Bahn station is just 2 min. walk from the hotel. There are not places of interest near the hotel area, but if you get a underground you are in 15 min. in the city center. There are few shops, restaurants and cafés near the hotel, but is enough. I recommend Italian restaurant Ischia ( go down the Brandenburgische str. and before you get to crossroad turn right). Hotel is clean, and offers all you need. Staff is OK, but we did not have any problems to solve with them. This hotel is much cheaper then ibis hotels located in the center, that is why we chose this one. Anyway I recommend this hotel to everyone who is looking for quiet, clean and good value hotel in Berlin. What a great time we had in Berlin.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington DC, District of Columbia, USA
Reviews.Title: “Great value - the IKEA of hotels”
Reviews.Author: Levain11
Reviews.Content: I was in Berlin on work and chose this hotel because it was convenient. The price was very reasonable (39E paid in advance on IBIS web site) and I was a bit worried because of that. Sounded too cheap to be true. But the hotel turned out to be very nice. The room was a decent size for one, it would do fine for a couple, and the bathroom was in a kind of enclosed pod in the corner. The pictures on the web site are accurate. Nothing more or less. I began to think of this as the IKEA of hotels, because it's cheap, functional, designed well and is clean. In terms of U.S. hotels, it is similar to the Courtyard Marriott or Holiday Inn Express hotels. The bed was firm and comfortable and the hotel very quiet (might have been the winter months, for it didn't seem crowded). They charge for room access to wifi but the cost was not great for several days (I think 39E for 7 days) which was worth it for me as I needed web access. Speed was fine for web and audio. There are small neighborhood restaurants nearby, some with English menus (try the bar Hell odor Dunkel, Güntzelstraße 24-- decent food and beer and English menu). The hotel was very accessible to other parts of town via U-Bann, and the service was very nice. I did the hotel breakfast since I had to leave very early in the morning and found the spread to be fresh and ample. I would go back to this hotel, but if going on vacation would actually try their other location in the Mitte. I'm sure it is the same.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: VFR-Adrian_vg
Reviews.Content: Attended Teched 2010 a week ago. Wifey was the co-traveller. This hotel was the nearest to Berlin Messe and that had a reasonable rate. The hotel is nice and clean in the reception and the staff very forthcoming. To the right in the reception area is a free-for-use internet-connected computer. Don't miss the mini-card-stand with rebates at various attractions and restuarant, next to the computer. A bit further in to the right is a bar area. Yet further in is the breakfast room. Skip the breakfast though at the hotel and instead go to the bakery across the street at the corner (go right when exiting the hotel), past the antiques shop. They serve a pretty decent breakfast for €3,95 (2010-11) with Scandinavian measures measured, and also gives you a chance to mingle with the locals instead of hotel guests... The neighbourhood is located in a semi-commercial condo-something area, so chances to met locals are good. The room we had was on the third floor, accessible via a lift (room-card operated) and halfway down the corridor. The double-room itself was relatively small, but good enough as a sleeping place. When travelling I'm, quite satisfied with a bed and a bathroom. The bed was wide and firm; top-notch! The bathroom featured a showercabin and free soap/schampoo. There is no tub. There is also no safe-box in the room, ask the staff in the reception for free use of their big safe in the luggage room. The room is otherwise pretty basic as mentioned and quite okay if your primary concern is what musems and other sights you should see first. This place is first and foremost a place to crash after a long day. Ibis City Berlin West offers a 24h "snack service" which might come in handy, didn't try it though. The hotel offers free taxi-call service, which came in handy. There is a U-bahn close by, Fehrbelliner Platz, approx 200m away. Some bus stops are closer by, but nowhere near as convenient as the U- and S-bahns. If you continue the street to the left when exiting the hotel, approx 300m, you'll get to a small centre-area with shops, supermarkets and some pretty good restaurants. The locals frequent these places, which is a good sign. We tried out croatian food at restaurant Galeb, italian at restaurant Milano and an authentic berliner Döner with bread at the "train place" just across the street from Milano. There's also a smallish take-away called "Isst was, trink was" that wifey said had some really good baclavas. There's also a japanese and a thai restaurant close by, we didn't try those. Close to the Fehrbelliner Ptz U-bahn, is Park Café, serving both café-stuff as well as more diner-like dishes. Things of notice/to beware of in Berlin: * The best apfelstrudel in Berlin I got, was at the Berlin Tegel Airport at Leyssers' or some such restaurant; a big chunk of strudel, creamy not too sweet, lots of apple and no frickin raisins(!). It cost me four Euros but was worth every cent! * Get a U-/S-bahn line map the first thing you do. * The world's most accepted card, Visa, is *NOT* very widely accepted in Berlin except at the bigger places like the Pergamon museum and the tv-tower. Instead the EC-card and Maestro far more accepted. * ATM's are located here and there, but note the withdrawal fees; they can differ quite a lot! * The U-/S-bahn ticket vending machines did not accept neither mine nor wifey's Visa-cards. * Taxi's usually accept Visa. Keep some cash for those awkward moments...

Reviews.Title: “cheap price and clean room with good service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: cheap price and clean room with good service and near by U-bahn

Reviews.Title: “It's cheap”
Reviews.Author: Miguel_Arturo
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok nothing special,the room looked very cheap made but it was clean and tidy,funny thing there is a phone in the room with a room service botton and if you dialed it to ask for anything you get someone telling you "we dont have room-service". It is not very practical if you want to be close to the touristic areas although the underground is just around the corner. the staff was not specially friendly, they were just polite! the hotel is cheap indeed and that is what you get too.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Quiet Location, in Lovely Berlin”
Reviews.Author: TheHairyMan
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 3 night stay in Berlin at the above hotel. The hotel is clean, as are the rooms (which are cleaned daily). Despite being away from the main tourist areas, the hotel is only 100yrds from two U-bahn stations, Febhrbelliner Platz and a similar distance from Blissestr. The area which the hotel is located in, is QUIET but safe. No problems from traffic or shady characters. Breakfast is extra (9.5 euro's I think) but is wholesome. It consists of a self help selection of cheeses, meats, cereals, toast, coffee, juices.... etc etc... Free internet and printer use is available, although this restricted to one computer only. So you have to be a little patient and be flexible with its use. But this comes in very handy for self check-ins. Staff at the hotel are friendly and speak excellent English. A hotel safe can be used to store passports. Also the usage of a locker room next to the reception to store baggage too. The rooms are of a fair size (we were in a double room) with modern bathroom applicances (apparently the hotel was renovated 18-24 months ago so everything is still in good working order). Overall, a good stay. We paid approx 207 euros, which for a major European city hotel, is a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: foxystoat1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 days after booking online on the Ibis website, paid 99 euros in advance on a cheap rate, no refund deal. I have to say that we were pleasantly surprised at the attention to detail , the funky decor within the hotel (the bathrooms are of the "pod" circular type, very modern and swish and comfortable, an fabulous all you could eat continental breakfast for 9 euros set us up for our full days out, we didn't arrive until 11pm local time but this was no problem as Ibis guaranteed the room until the following day anyway!! Cleanliness was good, very friendly multi-lingual staff ensured that we had a very pleasant stay. The flight back home was not until late evening, but the hotel were very obliging with a left luggage facility. Well situated, just 100 metres from the nearest underground station, which lay just 10 minutes from the central attractions. Would stay again without hesitation if I go back to Berlin!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, excellent value for money, would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: greenilltravellers
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with three friends for a five day break ,predominately to visit the Christmas markets. Although the hotel is 2 star rating, it was clean , modern , and comfortable and served our needs perfectly. The rooms are a reasonable size, the bathroom quite small, but overall it is excellent value for money. The only drawback was no tea making facilities in the bedrooms, but drinks could be purchased in the bar area. The four of us tended to meet in there to make plans for the day., and have a drink later in the evening after a full day out. The buffet breakfast cost 9 euros and are good, value with fresh fruit salad, yoghurt, hot rolls and croissants, cold meats, cheeses, fruit juice, tea and coffee. The staff were polite, friendly and helpful and their English was excellent. Public transport is excellent, Up to five people can travel in all the zones in Berlin for 15 euros per day, on the buses, overground and underground trains. It is clean, punctual,and fast. Individual tickets can also be purchased. The transfer from Tegel airport to the hotel on the bus and underground costs 2.10 euros each and allows up to 2 hours travel. You need to be fairly fit to carry your cases up and down the underground steps as not all the stations have lifts. The city bus tour gives an interesting insight to a new traveller, and you can get on and off to take a further look at somewhere you find particulary interesting. The Etheopian restaurant, Lalibela, around the corner from the hotel is excellent value, and the food is good. Berlin is a modern city with a lot of interesting places to visit, and if you like shopping , this is the place to go. I will definately go again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: gottagetgoing
Reviews.Content: I had never stayed in a Hotel Ibis before, and was pleasantly surprised to find it to be well-priced (in this expensive city), attractive, modern, clean, and with a nice breakfast. The little round private bathroom was a delight. The decor is sort of IKEA-ish, and that was just fine. The bread at breakfast was fabulous. The hotel is near the Fehrlingerplatz subway station, and I found it quite easy to navigate Berlin via public transportation with the able assistance of the many English-speaking desk clerks and their maps. I would return. The Ethiopian restaurant across the side street is an excellent family-run place with lovely service and tasty food.

Reviews.Title: “totally satisfied”
Reviews.Author: suxxxann
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel august 2004 because I had to stay in Berlin one night and this hotel being brand new was making some good offers. I paid for a double 42 euros. As said it was brand new so everything was properly functioning and it was clean. Staff was helpful. The only thing that might be unfriendly is the location. Not quite near the center but not absolutely in suburbs. I found it to be fine because at that time I had to attend a meeting that was only 5 stops of underground from hotel (transports are nearby) and I do remember that from the hotel to the mail train station there was only a short trip with a bus (15 minutes, direct bus) other than a very efficient and complete berlin underground. Location is quiet. There is a bar and restaurant inside. Not being in center of the town is the reason why I gave 4 and not 5. It is close to tempelhof airport.

HotelInfo.Name: Ibis Berlin City West
HotelInfo.Address: Brandenburgische Strasse 11 - Wilmersdorf, 10713 Berlin, Germany (Formerly Ibis Berlin Fehrbelliner Platz)
